laboratory_examinations.findings: Aneurysm of the ascending aorta measuring up to 6 cm in diameter with a focal outpouching, high-attenuation pericardial effusion, and filling defects in the right and left main pulmonary arteries suggestive of extensive pulmonary embolism.
Redemonstrated a focal dissection of the mid ascending aorta with posterior wall hematoma; no flow in the right main pulmonary artery and minimal flow detected in the left main pulmonary artery.
Demonstrated unobstructed main, right, and left pulmonary arteries, with normal flow. Contrast opacified pulmonary arteries without filling defect.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Changes noted from preoperative occlusion to postoperative unobstructed flow.
